title: Gondi - John (Print)
description: Gondi is a South-Central Dravidian language, spoken by about three million Gondi people, chiefly in the Indian states of Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and by small minorities in neighboring states. Although it is the language of the Gond people, it is highly endangered, with only one-fifth of Gonds speaking the language. Gondi has rich folk literature, examples of which are marriage songs and narrations. Gondi people are ethnically related to the Telugus.
